episodeTitle: The Worst Man in the Eastern Seas! Fish-Man Pirate Arlong!
episodeTitleJapanese: 東の海最悪の男！魚人海賊アーロン！
episodeTitleRomanized: Higashi no Umi Saiaku no Otoko! Gyojin Kaizoku Āron!
description: The Straw Hats learn from Yosaku that Nami has headed to Arlong Park, headquarters of the fearsome fish-man pirate Arlong who rules the Conomi Islands through terror and extortion. When Zoro, Johnny, and Usopp arrive, Zoro is captured and discovers Nami serves as an officer in Arlong's crew, shocking everyone with her apparent betrayal.

events.title: Introduction of the Seven Warlords of the Sea
events.description: Yosaku reveals crucial information about the Seven Warlords of the Sea (Shichibukai), a group of seven powerful pirates sanctioned by the World Government. He explains that Mihawk, whom they previously encountered, is one of these Warlords, and mentions that Jinbe, a fish-man, is another member of this elite group.
events.significance: This is the first detailed explanation of the Seven Warlords system, a major power structure in the One Piece world. This concept becomes increasingly important throughout the series as the Straw Hats encounter multiple Warlords. It establishes the political complexity of the pirate world and the World Government's strategy of using pirates to control other pirates.

quotes.text: The Seven Warlords of the Sea... they're seven pirates who've been given special rights by the World Government!
quotes.speaker: Yosaku
quotes.context: Yosaku explains the Shichibukai system to the Straw Hats

events.title: First Mention of Jinbe
events.description: Yosaku mentions Jinbe by name for the first time, identifying him as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea and a fish-man who previously worked with Arlong. This is a name-only reference, as Jinbe himself won't appear for hundreds of episodes, but it establishes his existence and connection to the current arc's antagonist.
events.significance: This is the first mention of Jinbe, who eventually becomes a crucial ally and later a member of the Straw Hat Pirates. The fact that he's mentioned 399 episodes before his actual appearance makes this one of the longest-running foreshadowing moments in the series. It also establishes the connection between Arlong and more powerful forces from the Grand Line.

quotes.text: Arlong used to work together with Jinbe, one of the Seven Warlords!
quotes.speaker: Yosaku
quotes.context: Yosaku reveals Arlong's connection to Warlord Jinbe

events.title: Fish-Man Superiority and Strength Revealed
events.description: Yosaku explains that fish-men possess ten times the physical strength of normal humans and can breathe underwater, making them formidable opponents especially in aquatic environments. He warns that Arlong, coming from the Grand Line, is even more dangerous than Don Krieg, establishing the threat level the crew is about to face.
events.significance: This introduces the biological advantages of fish-men, a concept that becomes important throughout the series. It establishes the physical inequality between races in the One Piece world and sets up the racial themes that will be explored more deeply in this arc and later in the Fish-Man Island arc.

quotes.text: Fish-men have ten times the strength of humans! And in the water, they're unbeatable!
quotes.speaker: Yosaku
quotes.context: Warning the crew about the danger of fish-men

events.title: Zoro, Johnny, and Usopp Approach Arlong Park
events.description: Zoro, accompanied by Johnny and Usopp, sails toward the Conomi Islands to pursue Nami. They discuss their plan to confront the situation, with Zoro characteristically wanting to charge in directly while Johnny and Usopp are more cautious about facing the notorious Arlong.
events.significance: This sets up Zoro's capture and the revelation about Nami. It shows Zoro's loyalty to his crewmate despite not fully understanding the situation, and establishes the geographic arrival at the arc's main setting.

events.title: Arlong's First Appearance
events.description: Arlong, the sawshark fish-man and captain of the Arlong Pirates, makes his dramatic first appearance. He is shown at Arlong Park, his fortress headquarters, demonstrating his authority and cruel nature. His distinctive appearance with his saw-shaped nose and imposing physique immediately establishes him as a formidable antagonist.
events.significance: Arlong serves as the primary antagonist of the Arlong Park Arc, one of the most emotionally impactful arcs in One Piece. His introduction marks the beginning of the arc that will deeply explore Nami's backstory and the themes of discrimination, oppression, and liberation. Arlong represents the first truly menacing villain of the series who rules through systematic terror rather than just strength.

quotes.text: Shahahaha! Humans are nothing but inferior creatures meant to serve us fish-men!
quotes.speaker: Arlong

events.title: Arlong and Nezumi's Corrupt Alliance Revealed
events.description: Captain Nezumi of the Marines is shown meeting with Arlong at Arlong Park, receiving bribe money in exchange for turning a blind eye to Arlong's activities in the Conomi Islands. This corrupt relationship has allowed Arlong to terrorize the region for years without Marine interference.
events.significance: This reveals the depth of corruption within the Marine system and explains how Arlong has been able to operate unchecked in the East Blue despite his 20 million berry bounty. It demonstrates that the threat isn't just from pirates, but from the systemic failures and corruption of those meant to protect civilians. This relationship becomes crucial later when Nezumi betrays Nami.

quotes.text: As always, Captain Nezumi, your cooperation is appreciated. Here is your payment.
quotes.speaker: Arlong
quotes.context: Arlong bribing the corrupt Marine captain

events.title: Captain Nezumi's First Appearance
events.description: Captain Nezumi, the corrupt Marine officer in charge of the 16th Branch, makes his first appearance. With his distinctive rat-like features and whiskers, he is shown accepting bribes from Arlong in exchange for ignoring the fish-man's criminal activities throughout the Conomi Islands.
events.significance: Nezumi represents the corruption within the Marine system and serves as a secondary antagonist in the arc. His actions enable Arlong's reign of terror and he later plays a crucial role in betraying Nami. Notably, he's also responsible for reporting Luffy to Marine Headquarters, resulting in Luffy's first official bounty.

events.title: Zoro Confronts the Arlong Pirates
events.description: As Zoro, Johnny, and Usopp attempt to infiltrate or scout Arlong Park, they are spotted by members of the Arlong Pirates. Usopp and Johnny panic and flee, abandoning their position. However, Zoro is tied up and unable to escape, leaving him vulnerable to capture by the fish-men.
events.significance: This sets up Zoro's capture and the confrontation that reveals Nami's position as an Arlong officer. It shows the fear that Arlong inspires even in experienced fighters like Johnny, and demonstrates Zoro's predicament.

events.title: Zoro Captured by Arlong Pirates
events.description: Zoro is captured by the Arlong Pirates after being abandoned by his frightened companions. He is brought before Arlong and interrogated. During this interrogation, Arlong expounds on his philosophy that fish-men are the superior race and that humans are inferior creatures meant to be ruled.
events.significance: This capture puts Zoro in a vulnerable position and leads directly to the shocking revelation about Nami. It also allows the audience to hear Arlong's racist ideology firsthand, establishing the thematic conflict of the arc beyond just a simple pirate battle.

quotes.text: You humans are nothing but an inferior species! Fish-men are the chosen race, destined to rule over you!
quotes.speaker: Arlong
quotes.context: Arlong lecturing the captured Zoro about fish-man supremacy

events.title: Nami Revealed as Arlong's Officer
events.description: In a shocking twist, Nami appears at Arlong Park and reveals herself to be an officer and official member of the Arlong Pirates, serving as their cartographer. She confronts the captured Zoro coldly, apparently confirming that she has betrayed the Straw Hat crew and was using them all along.
events.significance: This is one of the most shocking moments in early One Piece, completely recontextualizing Nami's character and her theft of the Going Merry. While later episodes reveal the tragic truth behind this betrayal, at this moment it appears as though Nami has genuinely chosen Arlong over the Straw Hats. This revelation drives the emotional core of the entire arc and sets up Nami's heartbreaking backstory.

quotes.text: I am an officer of the Arlong Pirates. I've been using you from the start.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's cold declaration to Zoro, hiding her true feelings and situation

events.title: Arlong Officers Introduction - Kuroobi, Chew, and Hatchan
events.description: The three main officers of the Arlong Pirates make their first appearance: Kuroobi (a ray fish-man and martial artist), Chew (a smelt-whiting fish-man with water-spitting abilities), and Hatchan (an octopus fish-man with six arms). They are shown at Arlong Park demonstrating their loyalty to Arlong.
events.significance: These three officers serve as secondary antagonists throughout the arc and will each face off against the Straw Hats. Their introduction establishes the hierarchy of the Arlong Pirates and the various threats the crew will need to overcome. Hatchan, in particular, becomes an important recurring character in later arcs.

events.title: Nojiko's First Appearance
events.description: Nojiko, Nami's adoptive older sister, makes her first appearance in the series. She is shown in Cocoyasi Village, a resident of the islands under Arlong's control. Her presence hints at the deeper backstory and connections that will be revealed about Nami's past.
events.significance: Nojiko is crucial to understanding Nami's backstory and motivations. Her introduction foreshadows the tragic history that will be revealed in upcoming episodes. She represents Nami's emotional ties to the Conomi Islands and the reason Nami endures her situation with Arlong.

events.title: Gosa Village Destruction Revealed
events.description: Johnny and Usopp discover the destroyed village of Gosa, where every building has been literally flipped upside down. They learn that this destruction was carried out by Arlong's forces as punishment for the village's inability to pay the monthly tribute demanded by the fish-man pirates.
events.significance: This scene demonstrates the brutal reality of Arlong's rule over the Conomi Islands and the systematic terror he uses to control the population. It shows that Arlong's threat isn't just to the Straw Hats but to innocent civilians who suffer under his tyranny. The visual of the upside-down buildings creates a memorable and disturbing image of Arlong's power.

quotes.text: The whole village... it's been destroyed! Every building is upside down!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Discovering the devastation of Gosa Village

events.title: Chabo's First Appearance
events.description: Chabo, a young boy from the destroyed Gosa Village, makes his first appearance. He is one of the few survivors of the village's destruction and harbors deep hatred for Arlong, who killed his father during the attack.
events.significance: Chabo represents the innocent victims of Arlong's reign and the generational trauma caused by his tyranny. His desire for revenge despite being a child shows the psychological impact of Arlong's rule on the population.

quotes.text: The Seven Warlords of the Sea... they're seven pirates who've been given special rights by the World Government!
quotes.speaker: Yosaku

quotes.text: Arlong used to work together with Jinbe, one of the Seven Warlords!
quotes.speaker: Yosaku

quotes.text: Fish-men have ten times the strength of humans! And in the water, they're unbeatable!
quotes.speaker: Yosaku

quotes.text: Shahahaha! Humans are nothing but inferior creatures meant to serve us fish-men!
quotes.speaker: Arlong

quotes.text: I am an officer of the Arlong Pirates. I've been using you from the start.
quotes.speaker: Nami

themes.description: The episode introduces Arlong's fish-man supremacist ideology, establishing one of the major themes of the arc. Arlong views humans as inferior beings worthy only of subjugation, mirroring real-world racism and discrimination.
themes.symbolism: The destroyed Gosa Village with buildings flipped upside-down symbolizes the inverted power structure Arlong has created, where the 'superior' fish-men rule over humans.

themes.description: The episode reveals how Arlong maintains his tyrannical rule not just through strength, but through systematic corruption of the Marines. Captain Nezumi's acceptance of bribes shows how institutional corruption enables oppression.
themes.symbolism: The bribe money changing hands represents the failure of justice systems and how those meant to protect can become complicit in tyranny.

themes.description: Nami's apparent betrayal of the Straw Hats creates a powerful emotional conflict. While viewers don't yet know the full truth, the theme of loyalty versus survival is established, questioning what people will do when forced into impossible situations.
themes.symbolism: Nami standing with Arlong against Zoro symbolizes the painful choices people make when trapped between loyalty and survival.

themes.description: The villages under Arlong's control must pay monthly tributes just to survive, literalizing the price of life under tyranny. Those who cannot pay, like Gosa Village, face destruction.
themes.symbolism: The monetary tribute system represents how oppression commodifies human life and dignity.

characterSpotlights.development: Arlong is established as a ruthless and intelligent villain who rules through systematic terror, corruption, and an ideology of racial superiority. His connection to the Grand Line and the Seven Warlords system establishes him as a serious threat.
keyActions: Makes his first appearance at Arlong Park
Bribes Captain Nezumi to maintain Marine cooperation
Expounds on his fish-man supremacist ideology
quotes: Shahahaha! Humans are nothing but inferior creatures meant to serve us fish-men!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami's role as an officer of the Arlong Pirates is revealed, creating a major twist. She appears cold and calculating, claiming she used the Straw Hats from the beginning. This episode deepens the mystery around her character.
keyActions: Appears at Arlong Park as an officer
Claims to have been using the Straw Hats
Demonstrates her position with Arlong's crew
quotes: I am an officer of the Arlong Pirates. I've been using you from the start.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his loyalty by pursuing Nami despite the danger, but is captured by the Arlong Pirates. He faces the shocking revelation of Nami's apparent betrayal while helpless.
keyActions: Sails to Arlong Park to find Nami
Gets captured by the Arlong Pirates

characterSpotlights.development: Yosaku serves as the primary source of crucial information this episode, explaining the Seven Warlords system, Jinbe, and the threat posed by fish-men and Arlong specifically.
keyActions: Explains the Seven Warlords of the Sea
Warns about fish-man capabilities and strength
Provides context about Arlong's Grand Line origins
quotes: The Seven Warlords of the Sea... they're seven pirates who've been given special rights by the World Government!
Arlong used to work together with Jinbe, one of the Seven Warlords!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on the exposition about the Seven Warlords with additional dialogue and visual presentation compared to the manga's more condensed explanation.
Some scenes showing the approach to Arlong Park and the crew's reactions are extended in the anime for pacing purposes.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of 'RUN! RUN! RUN!' as the new ending theme, replacing 'memories' which had been used since episode 1. Both songs were performed by Maki Otsuki.

sources.title: RUN! RUN! RUN! - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Jinbe is mentioned by name 399 episodes before his actual first appearance in Episode 430, making this one of the longest foreshadowing moments in One Piece.
This episode marks the beginning of the Arlong Park Arc, which is consistently rated by fans as one of the best arcs in One Piece, particularly for Nami's character development.
Arlong's bounty of 20,000,000 berries was the highest bounty in the East Blue at the time, double that of Don Krieg's 17,000,000.
The original Japanese broadcast of this episode on July 12, 2000 achieved an 11.5% TV rating, showing strong viewership during the East Blue saga.
